qas.question: What is known as the modification of an organism's genome through biotechnology?
When did techniques begin to be developed to add, remove and edit genes?
What sort of enzymes do recently developed genome engineering techniques use?
What sort of DNA repair is created by modern genetic engineering techniques?
What term refers to extensive genetic engineering of an organism?

context: <a0_0>Genetic engineering<a0_0/> is the modification of an organism's genome through biotechnology. Since <a1_0>the 1970s<a1_0/>, a variety of techniques have been developed to specifically add, remove and edit genes in an organism. Recently developed genome engineering techniques use <a2_0>engineered nuclease enzymes<a2_0/> to create <a3_0>targeted<a3_0/> DNA repair in a chromosome to either disrupt or edit a gene when the break is repaired. The related term <a4_0>synthetic biology<a4_0/> is sometimes used to refer to extensive genetic engineering of an organism.
